alert.note: Alert for Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Webster and southwestern Sumter Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Croxton Crossroads, or 10 miles southeast of Preston, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Plains, Sumter, Centerpoint, Dumas, Maddox and Croxton Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
